= Components =
(generated)


*Component items*:
  * *Ear sound sensory data* (*ear-sensory-sound-data*)
   * Ear - inner hair cells (ear-inner-hair-cells -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_SP LPC.PN.SG.SP]): frequency-aligned tonotopic mapping
   * Ear - outer hair cells feedback (ear-outer-hair-cells-feedback -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_SP LPC.PN.SG.SP]): verifies amplify actions done
   * Ear - somatic receptors (ear-somatic -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_GNG LPC.PN.SG.GNG]): from skin to geniculate ganglion to spinal trigeminal nucleus
   * Ear - outer ear skin (ear-external-skin -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_UDRG LPC.PN.SG.UDRG]): skin over the mastoid process, back of the auricle, lobule and a portion of the scalp
   * Ear - acoustic meatus skin (ear-acoustic-meatus-skin -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_TRG LPC.PN.SG.TRG]): from skin lining external acoustic meatus, and tympanic membrane to trigeminal gangion
   * Ear - visceral receptors (ear-visceral -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_JUG LPC.PN.SG.JUG]): pain, temperature, and touch
   * Ear - timpanic cavity (ear-timpanic-cavity -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_PET LPC.PN.SG.PET]): pain, temperature, and touch
  * *Ear vestibular sensory data* (*ear-sensory-vestibular-data*)
   * Ear - semicircular canals, cristae (ear-semicircular-canals -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_CVB LPC.PN.SG.CVB]): activate afferent receptors in response to rotational acceleration
   * Ear - utricle, maculae (ear-utricle -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_UVB LPC.PN.SG.UVB]): activate afferent receptors in response to horizontal linear acceleration
   * Ear - saccule, maculae (ear-saccule -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_SVB LPC.PN.SG.SVB]): activate afferent receptors in response to vertical linear acceleration
  * *Ear sound sensory control* (*ear-sensory-control*)
   * [http://www.d.umn.edu/~jfitzake/Lectures/UndergradPharmacy/SensoryPhysiology/Audition/OHCFunction.html Ear - outer hair cells] ([BrainRegionLPC_MM_SOC LPC.MM.SOC] -> [HumanMusclesHead ear-outer-hair-cells]): contracts basilar membrane; mechanically amplify low-level sound that enters cochlea
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stapedius Ear - stapedius muscle] ([BrainRegionLPC_HP_FCM LPC.HP.FCM] -> [HumanMusclesHead ear-stapedius]): dampens vibrations of stapes
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensor_tympani Ear - tympanic membrane muscle] ([BrainRegionLPC_HP_PTP_TRM LPC.HP.PTP.TRM] -> [HumanMusclesHead ear-tensor-tympani-muscle]): dampen sounds, such as those produced from chewing
  * *Ear move muscles* (*ear-move*)
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anterior_auricular_muscle Ear - anterior auricular muscle] ([BrainRegionLPC_HP_FCM LPC.HP.FCM] -> [HumanMusclesHead ear-anterior-auricular-muscle]): pulls ear forward
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Posterior_auricular_muscle Ear - posterior auricular muscle] ([BrainRegionLPC_HP_FCM LPC.HP.FCM] -> [HumanMusclesHead ear-posterior-auricular-muscle]): pulls ear backward
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superior_auricular_muscle Ear - superior auricular muscle] ([BrainRegionLPC_HP_FCM LPC.HP.FCM] -> [HumanMusclesHead ear-superior-auricular-muscle]): pulls ear upward
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oblique_muscle_of_auricle Ear - oblique muscle of auricle] ([BrainRegionLPC_HP_FCM LPC.HP.FCM] -> [HumanMusclesHead ear-oblique-auricular-muscle]): movement of the ears
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Temporoparietalis_muscle Ear - temporoparietalis muscle] ([BrainRegionLPC_HP_FCM LPC.HP.FCM] -> [HumanMusclesHead ear-temporoparietalis-muscle]): assist the frontal belly in drawing the epicranial aponeurosis towards the front of the cranium
